opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: John Vernon Deckard v. Warden, Missouri State Penitentiary

opinion:
386 U.S. 284

87 S.Ct. 1041

18 L.Ed.2d 50

John Vernon DECKARD
v.
WARDEN, MISSOURI STATE PENITENTIARY.

No. 533, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

March 13, 1967

John Vernon Deckard, pro se.

Norman H. Anderson, Atty. Gen. of Missouri, and Howard L. McFadden, Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of Missouri.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Supreme Court of Missouri for further consideration. Swenson v. Bosler, 386 U.S. 258, 87 S.Ct. 996, 18 L.Ed.2d 33; Eskridge v. Washington State Board of Prison Terms and Paroles, 357 U.S. 214, 78 S.Ct. 1061, 2 L.Ed.2d 1269; Tehan v. United States ex rel. Shott, 382 U.S. 406, 416, 86 S.Ct. 459, 15 L.Ed.2d 453.
